trans-unit.source: Render textures
trans-unit.target: Render textures

trans-unit.source: Intermediate Designer Programmer
trans-unit.target: Intermediate Designer Programmer

trans-unit.source: With render textures, you can send a camera's view to a texture and use the texture on objects in your scene. For example, you can use this to display part of your scene on a TV screen in the same scene, such as security camera footage.
trans-unit.target: With render textures, you can send a camera's view to a texture and use the texture on objects in your scene. For example, you can use this to display part of your scene on a TV screen in the same scene, such as security camera footage.

trans-unit.source: For API details, see Textures and render textures.
trans-unit.target: For API details, see Textures and render textures.

trans-unit.source: 1. Create an extra camera slot
trans-unit.target: 1. Create an extra camera slot

trans-unit.source: Camera slots link the graphics compositor to the cameras in your scene. You need to add a camera slot for a new camera to use. For more information about camera slots, see Camera slots.
trans-unit.target: Camera slots link the graphics compositor to the cameras in your scene. You need to add a camera slot for a new camera to use. For more information about camera slots, see Camera slots.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor asset
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor asset

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor editor opens.
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor editor opens.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor editor
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor editor

trans-unit.source: On the left, under Camera slots, click Green plus button (Add).
trans-unit.target: On the left, under Camera slots, click Green plus button (Add).

trans-unit.source: Camera slots
trans-unit.target: Camera slots

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a new camera slot.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a new camera slot.

trans-unit.source: !Tip To rename a camera slot, double-click it in the list and type a new name. Name a camera slot
trans-unit.target: !Tip To rename a camera slot, double-click it in the list and type a new name. Name a camera slot

trans-unit.source: 2. Create a camera and bind it to the slot
trans-unit.target: 2. Create a camera and bind it to the slot

trans-unit.source: In your scene, add a camera component to the entity you want to be your camera.
trans-unit.target: In your scene, add a camera component to the entity you want to be your camera.

trans-unit.source: Add camera component
trans-unit.target: Add camera component

trans-unit.source: Position the entity so the camera captures the area of the scene you want to render to a texture.
trans-unit.target: Position the entity so the camera captures the area of the scene you want to render to a texture.

trans-unit.source: In the entity Property Grid, enable the Camera component using the checkbox.
trans-unit.target: In the entity Property Grid, enable the Camera component using the checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Enable camera component
trans-unit.target: Enable camera component

trans-unit.source: in the Camera component properties, under Slot, select the slot you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: in the Camera component properties, under Slot, select the slot you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Select camera slot
trans-unit.target: Select camera slot

trans-unit.source: 3. Create a render target texture
trans-unit.target: 3. Create a render target texture

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click Add asset and select Texture > Render target.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click Add asset and select Texture > Render target.

trans-unit.source: Add render target
trans-unit.target: Add render target

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a render target texture to your project assets.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a render target texture to your project assets.

trans-unit.source: Render texture
trans-unit.target: Render texture

trans-unit.source: 4. Place the render target texture in the scene
trans-unit.target: 4. Place the render target texture in the scene

trans-unit.source: There are various ways you can use the render target texture.
trans-unit.target: There are various ways you can use the render target texture.

trans-unit.source: Example 1: Use the render target texture in a material
trans-unit.target: Example 1: Use the render target texture in a material

trans-unit.source: In the material properties, under Shading, next to Diffuse map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Texture.
trans-unit.target: In the material properties, under Shading, next to Diffuse map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Texture.

trans-unit.source: Select texture
trans-unit.target: Select texture

trans-unit.source: Click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: Click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: Select the Render texture asset and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the Render texture asset and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Select render frame
trans-unit.target: Select render frame

trans-unit.source: Example 2: Use the render target texture in a sprite component
trans-unit.target: Example 2: Use the render target texture in a sprite component

trans-unit.source: Create an entity and position it where you want to display the texture.
trans-unit.target: Create an entity and position it where you want to display the texture.

trans-unit.source: With the entity selected, in the Property Grid, click Add component and add a sprite component.
trans-unit.target: With the entity selected, in the Property Grid, click Add component and add a sprite component.

trans-unit.source: Add sprite component
trans-unit.target: Add sprite component

trans-unit.source: In the sprite component properties, next to Source, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Texture.
trans-unit.target: In the sprite component properties, next to Source, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Texture.

trans-unit.source: Select sprite source
trans-unit.target: Select sprite source

trans-unit.source: Click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: Click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Select the Render texture asset and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the Render texture asset and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Select render frame
trans-unit.target: Select render frame

trans-unit.source: If you don't want the texture to be semi-transparent, under the Source properties, clear the Is transparent checkbox.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want the texture to be semi-transparent, under the Source properties, clear the Is transparent checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Clear-is-transparent
trans-unit.target: Clear-is-transparent

trans-unit.source: 5. Set up the graphics compositor
trans-unit.target: 5. Set up the graphics compositor

trans-unit.source: To display a render texture in your scene, you need at least two renderers:
trans-unit.target: To display a render texture in your scene, you need at least two renderers:

trans-unit.source: one to render your main camera
trans-unit.target: one to render your main camera

trans-unit.source: one to render the second camera to the render texture
trans-unit.target: one to render the second camera to the render texture

trans-unit.source: This page describes the simplest way to do this from scratch, using two cameras and two renderers. Depending on your pipeline, you might need to create a different setup.
trans-unit.target: This page describes the simplest way to do this from scratch, using two cameras and two renderers. Depending on your pipeline, you might need to create a different setup.

trans-unit.source: !Warning These instructions involve deleting your existing renderers for the game entry point. You might want to make a backup of your project in case you want to restore your pipeline afterwards.
trans-unit.target: !Warning These instructions involve deleting your existing renderers for the game entry point. You might want to make a backup of your project in case you want to restore your pipeline afterwards.

trans-unit.source: In the graphics compositor editor, select the Entry points node.
trans-unit.target: In the graphics compositor editor, select the Entry points node.

trans-unit.source: Entry points node
trans-unit.target: Entry points node

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid on the right, next to Game renderer, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select None to delete your existing renderers.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid on the right, next to Game renderer, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select None to delete your existing renderers.

trans-unit.source: Cleared game renderers
trans-unit.target: Cleared game renderers

trans-unit.source: Click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Scene renderer collection.
trans-unit.target: Click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select Scene renderer collection.

trans-unit.source: Select scene renderer collection
trans-unit.target: Select scene renderer collection

trans-unit.source: This lets you set multiple renderers for the game entry point.
trans-unit.target: This lets you set multiple renderers for the game entry point.

trans-unit.source: 1. Render the main camera
trans-unit.target: 1. Render the main camera

trans-unit.source: Under Game renderer, next to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select Camera renderer.
trans-unit.target: Under Game renderer, next to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select Camera renderer.

trans-unit.source: Select camera renderer
trans-unit.target: Select camera renderer

trans-unit.source: Next to Camera, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select your main game camera.
trans-unit.target: Next to Camera, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select your main game camera.

trans-unit.source: Select main camera
trans-unit.target: Select main camera

trans-unit.source: Next to Child, select the renderer for your main game camera (eg the forward renderer).
trans-unit.target: Next to Child, select the renderer for your main game camera (eg the forward renderer).

trans-unit.source: Select forward render
trans-unit.target: Select forward render

trans-unit.source: 2. Render the texture
trans-unit.target: 2. Render the texture

trans-unit.source: Under Game renderer, next to Add to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select Camera renderer.
trans-unit.target: Under Game renderer, next to Add to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select Camera renderer.

trans-unit.source: Select camera renderer
trans-unit.target: Select camera renderer

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a camera renderer to the list of children.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a camera renderer to the list of children.

trans-unit.source: Second camera renderer
trans-unit.target: Second camera renderer

trans-unit.source: Expand the second camera renderer.
trans-unit.target: Expand the second camera renderer.

trans-unit.source: Expand second renderer
trans-unit.target: Expand second renderer

trans-unit.source: Next to Camera, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the camera you want to render to a texture.
trans-unit.target: Next to Camera, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the camera you want to render to a texture.

trans-unit.source: Select texture camera
trans-unit.target: Select texture camera

trans-unit.source: Next to Child, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select RenderTextureSceneRenderer.
trans-unit.target: Next to Child, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select RenderTextureSceneRenderer.

trans-unit.source: Select render texture scene renderer
trans-unit.target: Select render texture scene renderer

trans-unit.source: Under the RenderTextureSceneRenderer, next to Child, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the renderer for your main game camera (eg the forward renderer).
trans-unit.target: Under the RenderTextureSceneRenderer, next to Child, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the renderer for your main game camera (eg the forward renderer).

trans-unit.source: Select forward renderer
trans-unit.target: Select forward renderer

trans-unit.source: Next to Render texture, click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: Next to Render texture, click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Select the render texture and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the render texture and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Select render texture
trans-unit.target: Select render texture

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the render texture to the renderer.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the render texture to the renderer.

trans-unit.source: Render texture added
trans-unit.target: Render texture added

trans-unit.source: Your game is now ready to render the camera to the texture in the scene.
trans-unit.target: Your game is now ready to render the camera to the texture in the scene.

trans-unit.source: Set a render mask
trans-unit.target: Set a render mask

trans-unit.source: You can use the render mask to filter which groups are rendered in the render texture.
trans-unit.target: You can use the render mask to filter which groups are rendered in the render texture.

trans-unit.source: Next to Render mask, click Change values and select the render groups you want the camera to render.
trans-unit.target: Next to Render mask, click Change values and select the render groups you want the camera to render.

trans-unit.source: Render mask
trans-unit.target: Render mask

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Render groups and masks.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Render groups and masks.

trans-unit.source: Sample
trans-unit.target: Sample

trans-unit.source: For an example of rendering to a texture in a project, see the Animation sample included with Stride.
trans-unit.target: For an example of rendering to a texture in a project, see the Animation sample included with Stride.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

source.g: Low-level API – Textures and render textures

target.g: Low-level API – Textures and render textures
